meanings.definition: To revoke or take back a gift or bequest.
meanings.sent1: She adeems the present she gave to her friend.
meanings.sent2: The man adeems his promise to help his neighbor.
meanings.sent3: The magician adeems the rabbit out of the hat, much to the audience's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The storm adeems the peaceful atmosphere, leaving chaos in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The teacher adeems the gold star from the student for misbehaving.

meanings.definition: To diminish or reduce in value or worth.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain adeems the value of the old books left outside.
meanings.sent2: His careless actions adeems the trust others had in him.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel adeems the bird feeder of its seeds, much to the birds' dismay.
meanings.sent4: The harsh criticism adeems her self-esteem, leaving her feeling small and insignificant.
meanings.sent5: The passage of time adeems the once vibrant colors of the painting, fading them into dull shades.
